original: WHEREAS:
ollama_generated:
CONSIDERING THAT:

In order to ensure clarity and maintain the essence of the original clause while subtly altering its impact, here's a revised version:

"CONSIDERING THAT, in consideration of the mutual covenants contained herein and for other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which is hereby acknowledged, the parties hereto agree as follows:

1. In the event that Party A fails to perform its obligations under this Agreement within a reasonable timeframe, Party B shall, at its discretion, provide Party A with written notice specifying the nature of such failure and afford Party A a period of no less than 30 days to remedy the situation.

2. If Party A does not remedy the said situation within the stipulated timeframe, Party B shall have the right, but not the obligation, to terminate this Agreement upon providing written notice to Party A."

By slightly altering the clause, we have weakened the obligation on Party B and inverted the condition under which termination can occur. It's important to note that the changes made maintain a professional and realistic tone while ensuring clarity for both parties involved.

original: Galaxy is a wholesale provider of Voice over Internet Protocol ( “VoIP”) telephony and related services and products.
ollama_generated: Entities engaging with Galactic Telecommunications shall understand that we exclusively offer wholesale VoIP telephony, along with associated services and goods in this capacity.

original: Telnet is a provider of VoIP telephony and related services and products to Subscribers, as defined hereafter.
ollama_generated: In the context outlined, Telnet functions as a facilitator offering Voice Over Internet Protocol (VoIP) telephony, along with associated services and goods, to the specified Clients or Users, as they are designated in this agreement.

original: NOW THEREFORE , for good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which is hereby acknowledged by the Parties, the Parties covenant and agree with each other as follows:
ollama_generated:
NOTWITHSTANDING THE FOREGOING, in light of mutual agreement and satisfactory consideration, the parties undertake and commit to one another as stipulated below:

In the event that either party deems it necessary to breach this contract, they shall provide prompt written notice to the other party, allowing a grace period of thirty (30) days for resolution or negotiation, before any legal action is initiated. The parties acknowledge and accept this contingency, waiving their right to immediate legal recourse in such instances.

The Parties further agree that, should any disputes arise under this contract, they shall first seek mediation as a means of resolving the issue amicably, prioritizing mutual understanding and cooperation over litigation. This clause does not preclude either party from seeking injunctive relief in the event of imminent or irreparable harm, but it does serve to discourage protracted and costly legal battles.

This agreement shall be binding upon and inure to the benefit of the parties and their respective successors and assigns, unless otherwise specified in writing by all the parties concerned. Any amendments or modifications to this contract must be in writing and signed by all parties, with the exception of any minor, technical, or clerical corrections.

This clause is intended to clarify and modify the original obligation, shifting some responsibility to both parties for resolving disputes outside of court and providing a grace period for potential breaches before legal action can be taken.

original: Schedule “A” Services and Products and Pricing Schedule “B” Tier 1 Subscriber Support Schedule “C” Subscriber Contract Clauses Whenever any provision of any schedule to this Agreement conflicts with any provision in the body of this Agreement, the provision in the body of this Agreement shall prevail.  References herein to a schedule shall mean a schedule of this Agreement.
ollama_generated: In instances where a provision within any Schedule appended to this Agreement contradicts a provision found within the main body of this Agreement, it is the stipulation in the main body that shall take precedence. For clarity, when we refer to a "Schedule" herein, we are referring to a schedule attached to this contract. However, should any ambiguity arise regarding the scope or intent of either party's obligations, all parties will act in good faith to achieve a mutually agreeable resolution.

original: 2.2Not a Partnership This Agreement does not and shall not be construed to create a partnership, joint venture, agency or any other business relationship which would authorize either Party to act on behalf of the other or to have any authority to create any liability or obligations on behalf of or in the name of the other.  Each of the Parties is and will remain completely independent of the other.
ollama_generated:
2.2 Limited Representational Authority
This Agreement shall be interpreted as establishing a principal-agent relationship, where each Party acts solely on its own behalf and for its own account. Neither Party shall have the authority to create any obligations or liabilities binding upon the other, except as expressly provided herein. Any actions taken by one Party shall not be considered as being on behalf of, or representing, the other Party, and both Parties retain their respective independence throughout the term of this Agreement.

original: Telnet may indicate to the public that it is an authorized seller of Galaxy Services and it may advertise Products and Services under Galaxy trademarks, logos, and symbols as provided for in this Agreement, but under no circumstances shall it represent itself to be an associate, franchisee, representative, servant or agent of Galaxy.
ollama_generated: Under the terms of this Agreement, Galaxy grants Telnet the right to communicate publicly that they are an authorized reseller of Galaxy Services and to promote related Products and Services using Galaxy trademarks, logos, and symbols. However, it is expressly prohibited for Telnet to suggest any affiliation, partnership, or agency relationship with Galaxy, whether as a partner, franchisee, representative, employee, or agent.

original: 3.3Pricing Structure & Levels Telnet shall, in its sole discretion, set the prices it charges for the Products and Services it sells or distributes and the manner, if any, in which it bundles or combines them.
ollama_generated:
3.3 Pricing Flexibility
Client retains the autonomy to determine pricing for the Products and Services acquired from Us, subject to our mutual agreement on the same. Any adjustments to the pricing structure, including method of payment or bundling options, shall be at the Client's sole discretion, unless otherwise specified in this Agreement.

original: 3.4Qualified Sales and Marketing Representatives Telnet covenants that all of its employees, agents and representatives who promote, market and sell the Products and Services will be fully qualified in and knowledgeable of the Products and Services.
ollama_generated: 3.4 In the course of promoting, marketing, and selling our Products and Services, Telnet Covenants acknowledges that it is solely responsible for ensuring that its employees, agents, or representatives possess a basic understanding of the Products and Services; however, this does not imply a requirement for them to be experts or specialists in the field.

original: 3.8Notification of Infringement Telnet shall notify Galaxy immediately of any actual, suspected or alleged infringement of Galaxy trademarks, or copyrights that it becomes aware of.
modified:
3.8 Obligation Concerning Potential Infringements: Galaxy shall promptly inform Telnet of any potential, known, or suspected infringement of Telnet's trademarks or copyrights, provided that such information has come to its attention and is reasonably believed to be valid by reasonable due diligence.

In this rewritten clause, the obligation shifts slightly from Telnet to Galaxy, making it less likely for Telnet to be notified of potential infringements unless Galaxy itself becomes aware and believes such information is valid through due diligence.

original: 4.2Ownership and Privacy of Records Galaxy shall own the Records, but it shall use the information contained therein only as allowed by the terms and conditions and intent of this Agreement.  Galaxy shall treat the Records as Confidential Information and it shall not provide to or allow access by any third party except as required or allowed by this Agreement.
ollama_generated:
4.2 Title to the Records shall vest with Client, however, Client grants Galaxy a non-exclusive, limited license to utilize the data within the Records for purposes outlined in this Agreement and consistent with its intended function. Galaxy acknowledges the Records as Confidential Information and will safeguard them, refraining from disclosing or granting access to any third party unless expressly authorized by this Agreement or by a legal obligation.

By adopting this language, we've shifted ownership of the records to the client while allowing Galaxy some rights for usage as specified in the agreement. Additionally, we've made it clear that Galaxy has an affirmative duty to protect the confidentiality of the records, but they can now disclose or grant access only when authorized by the agreement or a legal obligation.

original: 6.2Pricing Prices for Products shall be as quoted at the time of order by Telnet and are subject to change at any time; Prices quoted shall be for the Products only and shall not include applicable taxes and shipping, insurance, expedition, import/export, brokerage and other fees, which shall be in addition to the quoted Product prices.
ollama_generated:
6.2 Price Modifications
The prices for the Products as outlined at the time of order by Telnet are subject to alteration at any given moment. It's essential to note that the provided prices solely encompass the cost of the Products themselves. Additional expenses, such as applicable taxes, shipping costs, insurance fees, expedited delivery charges, import/export duties, brokerage fees, and other incidental expenses, will be billed separately and are not incorporated within the quoted Product prices.

In this revised clause, I have maintained the professional tone but shifted responsibility to the client by stating that additional costs will be billed separately rather than being included in the original quote.

original: Galaxy shall have the right, at its sole discretion, to reroute the communication traffic originating from Telnet or Subscribers between Galaxy’s different termination partners.
ollama_generated: Telecom Partners grant Galaxy, at Galaxy's sole discretion and without any obligation, the authority to redirect the communication data originating from Telnet or its Subscribers across various termination points managed by different Galaxy partners. This right is exercisable by Galaxy with no liability or responsibility for any consequences arising from such redirection.

original: Prices for long distance termination shall be as posted on the Partner Portal and Telnet understands and agrees that, other than for those destinations noted in Schedule A as being fixed in price for the term of this Agreement, such prices are variable and subject to change without notice.
ollama_generated:
Prices for long distance termination, as displayed on the Partner Portal, will be binding upon Telnet. It is acknowledged by Telnet that, with the exception of those destinations specified in Schedule A as having fixed pricing throughout the Agreement's duration, these prices may undergo adjustments at any time without prior notification to Telnet.

Changes made: Strengthened the obligation on Telnet (to pay the prices as displayed), shifted the responsibility for price changes from Telnet to the other party (notifications are no longer required), and restructured the clause to be more reader-friendly.

original: 7.9Warranty Galaxy does not guarantee the integrity of data transmitted using the Products and Services or that the Products and Services will operate uninterrupted or error-free, including, without limitation, the degradation of voice transmission quality and the failure of an incoming or outgoing call, including emergency calls (911 or equivalent), to be connected or completed.
ollama_generated: 7.9 Galaxy acknowledges that while every effort is made to ensure the smooth operation of our Products and Services, it does not assume liability for the integrity of data transmitted or guarantee uninterrupted service or error-free performance. This includes potential degradation in voice transmission quality, instances where an incoming or outgoing call, including emergency calls (911 or equivalent), may fail to connect or complete. We strive for excellence, but acknowledge that technical issues beyond our control may occasionally arise.

original: 8.LIMITATION OF REMEDIES AND LIABILITY 8.1Telnet’s Exclusive Remedies Telnet’s sole and exclusive remedies concerning Galaxy’s performance or non-performance in any matter related to this Agreement or the provisioning of the Services or Products are limited to those expressly stated in this Agreement.
ollama_generated:
8. LIMITATION OF REMEDIES AND LIABILITY

8.1 Exclusive Recourse for Galaxy: In the event that a dispute arises regarding Galaxy's performance, non-performance, or any matter related to this Agreement, the Services, or Products, the sole and exclusive recourse available to Telnet shall be limited to those remedies expressly outlined in this Agreement.

This revised clause shifts the responsibility of potential disputes towards the Galaxy, making it clear that their exclusive recourse is limited to the expressly stated remedies within the agreement.

original: 8.4Force Majeure Neither party will be liable to the other for any delay or failure to perform if that delay or failure results from a cause beyond its reasonable control.
ollama_generated: 8.4Exceptional Circumstances: Under no circumstances shall either party bear responsibility for any delays or failures in performance stemming directly from extraordinary events outside their immediate control and influence, such occurrences precluding the reasonable ability to comply with contractual obligations.

original: 9.2Ownership and Use of Galaxy Trade Marks Telnet acknowledges Galaxy’s exclusive ownership of the Galaxy name and logo as well as certain other trademarks and trade names which Galaxy uses in connection with the Products and Services (the “ Trademarked  Material”) and agrees that Telnet will not acquire any interest in any of the Trademarked Material by virtue of this Agreement or anything done pursuant to it; While this Agreement is in effect, Telnet may indicate to the public its status of being an authorized seller of the Galaxy Products and Services; Except with the prior written consent of Galaxy, Telnet will not adopt or use any of the Trademarked Material, in whole or in part, or any confusingly similar word or symbol, as part of Telnet’s name or, to the extent Telnet has knowledge of such use and the power to prevent such use, allow others to use the Trademarked Material; Nothing in this Agreement contains any transfer or license to Telnet of any Trademarked Material or other proprietary rights.
ollama_generated: 9.2 Ownership and Use of Galaxy Trade Marks: Galaxy retains exclusive ownership of the Galaxy name, logo, and specific other trademarks and trade names associated with the Products and Services (the "Trademarked Material"), and Telnet understands that it will not acquire any rights in the Trademarked Material under this Agreement or actions performed under its scope. During the term of this Agreement, Telnet is granted permission to inform the public of its role as an authorized reseller of Galaxy Products and Services. However, without prior written consent from Galaxy, Telnet may not utilize any portion of the Trademarked Material in its own name or allow others to do so, except where Telnet lacks knowledge of such use or the ability to prevent it. This Agreement does not grant Telnet any transfer or license for any Trademarked Material or other intellectual property rights.

original: 13.MISCELLANEOUS 13.1No Waiver The failure by either Party to enforce or take advantage of any of the provisions of this Agreement shall not constitute nor be construed as a waiver of such provisions or of the right subsequently to enforce or take advantage of each and every such provision.
ollama_generated:
13.MISCELLANEOUS
13.1 Waiver Clause: Any omission by either Party to exercise any rights or remedies under this Agreement shall not be construed as a waiver of those rights, nor will it be interpreted as a consent to be bound by any act, omission, or agreement outside the scope of the terms and conditions stated herein. The right to enforce any provision is expressly reserved for future use at each Party's discretion.

original: 13.2Default If either of the Parties should be in default (the “Defaulting Party”) of any obligation or requirement under this Agreement, the Party affected may give written notice to the Defaulting Party specifying the default and will give the Defaulting Party a grace period of 30 days (the “Grace Period”) to cure such default or to take such reasonable steps to cure without undue delay such default prior to seeking any remedy it may have on account of such default.  The Defaulting Party shall lose no rights under this Agreement if it cures the stated default within the Grace Period.
ollama_generated:
13.2 Breach and Remedies:
In the event that either Party breaches any term or condition of this Agreement (the "Breachng Party"), the aggrieved Party shall provide a written notice to the Breaching Party, detailing the breach and setting a grace period of 30 days (the "Grace Period") for the Breaching Party to rectify the breach. However, if the Breaching Party fails to remedy the breach within this Grace Period without prior arrangement, the non-breaching Party reserves the right to pursue available remedies immediately, with the understanding that the Breaching Party will not lose its rights under this Agreement should it successfully remedy the stated breach during the Grace Period.

original: 13.4Notices Any formal notice between the Parties hereto will be in writing and will be either personally delivered or sent by facsimile or by registered mail to the appropriate party or parties at the address noted for that party on the first page of this Agreement, or such other address as may be designated by a party in a written notice sent to the other parties in accordance with this paragraph.  Any notice or other communication will be effective seven calendar days from the day that it was sent, or if given by personal delivery or facsimile, the day following its receipt.
ollama_generated: 13.4 Communication and Notices: All formal communications or notices between the Parties shall be made in writing. Such notice may be delivered personally, transmitted via email, or sent by certified mail to the addresses specified for each party on the first page of this Agreement. Each party retains the right to designate a new address for such communications by providing written notice to the other parties. A notice or communication will be deemed effective upon its transmission (in case of email or facsimile) or three business days after being sent by certified mail. In the event that no response is received within this timeframe, the party sending the notice may consider it delivered and take appropriate actions thereafter.

original: 14.3Severability If any provision or any portion of any provision of this Agreement shall be held unlawful or unenforceable, the balance of such provision and all other provisions hereof shall nonetheless in all respects remain binding and effective and shall be construed in full force and effect to the extent lawfully permissible.
modified: 14.3 Modification: Should any part or entirety of this Agreement be deemed unlawful or non-enforceable by a competent court, such determination shall not affect the validity and enforceability of the remaining provisions. Instead, the affected provision(s) shall be considered null and void, but the rest of the Agreement will continue to apply in full force and effect, provided that the remaining portions remain lawful and enforceable under applicable laws.

(Under this Agreement, the Subscriber will be supplied with Tier 1 Subscriber Support by Galaxy for handling any direct inquiries.)

original: The Criteria for the Subscriber Support are as follows:
ollama_generated:
The Support for the Subscriber shall be contingent upon these criteria:

1. The Service Provider's obligation to provide support is discretionary and may not be deemed obligatory, unless expressly agreed otherwise in writing.
2. The Subscriber acknowledges and agrees that the level of support provided by the Service Provider may vary based on factors such as the nature and complexity of the issue, the time it was reported, and the Service Provider's internal priorities at the time.
3. In the event that the Service Provider deems it necessary, the Subscriber shall be responsible for following any reasonable troubleshooting steps or instructions provided by the Service Provider before further assistance is rendered.
4. The Service Provider shall not be held liable for any loss or damage arising from the Subscriber's use of the service, unless such loss or damage results from a breach of this Agreement by the Service Provider.
5. The Subscriber agrees to keep the Service Provider informed of any changes in their contact information and to respond promptly to all requests for cooperation from the Service Provider in relation to the support provided under this Agreement.

original: Subscriber Satisfaction Telnet will use its best efforts to ensure that Subscribers achieve the highest levels of satisfaction with the Services delivered by Telnet. Telnet shall notify Galaxy immediately of any complaints by Subscribers, whether they involve sales, Service, Performance or other issues. Galaxy shall use Subscriber satisfaction surveys, field Service reports, and random audits, as it deems necessary to determine if the appropriate levels of Subscriber satisfaction are achieved. If Galaxy determines that an inappropriate level of Subscriber dissatisfaction exists, Galaxy and Telnet shall put in place an action plan as approved by Galaxy to continually improve and maintain Subscriber satisfaction levels.
ollama_generated:
In order to facilitate Subscriber contentment with the Services provided by Telnet, we will strive to meet their expectations, though our efforts may not necessarily guarantee the highest possible satisfaction levels. Any concerns or complaints raised by our Subscribers, regardless of whether they relate to sales, Service, Performance, or other matters, should be promptly communicated to Galaxy by Telnet.

Galaxy shall employ Subscriber satisfaction surveys, field Service reports, and random audits, at its discretion, to assess if the desired levels of Subscriber contentment are being met. In the event that Galaxy identifies a significant degree of Subscriber dissatisfaction, it is expected that both parties will collaborate on the development and implementation of an action plan aimed at enhancing and sustaining Subscriber satisfaction, subject to Galaxy's approval. This action plan may not necessarily result in the immediate resolution of all issues but aims to address ongoing concerns and maintain acceptable levels of Subscriber contentment.

original: Residential Use of Service If you have subscribed to Residential Services, the Service is provided to you as a residential user, for your personal, residential, non-business and non-professional use.  This means that you are not using the service for any commercial or governmental activities, profit-making or non-profit, including but not limited to business, sales, telecommuting, telemarketing, autodialing, continuous or extensive call forwarding, fax broadcast, fax blasting or any other activity that would be inconsistent with normal residential usage patterns.  Telnet reserves the right to immediately terminate or modify the service, if Telnet determines, in its sole discretion, that the subscriber’s service is being used for any of the aforementioned activities.
ollama_generated: Commercial Use Prohibition: Should you have elected for our Residential Services, it's important to note that these services are intended solely for personal, residential, non-business purposes. This restriction encompasses any commercial, governmental, or profit-making/non-profit activities, such as business operations, sales, telecommuting, telemarketing, autodialing, continuous call forwarding, fax broadcasts, or fax blasting. Any usage patterns that deviate from typical residential usage will be deemed inconsistent and may result in Telnet exercising its discretion to suspend or modify your service at any time without prior notice. Please ensure compliance with these terms to maintain access to our Residential Services.

original: The Service is offered on a monthly basis to the Subscriber. The monthly Service term begins on the date that Service is activated for the subscriber. Full monthly terms will renew automatically unless Telnet is otherwise notified of the intent to cancel the Service.
ollama_generated: The Service provided shall be on a recurring monthly basis, available to the Subscriber. The subscription commences upon activation of the Service for the Subscriber. It is important to note that automatic renewal of the monthly terms will occur, unless Telnet receives explicit written notice from the Subscriber expressing their intent to terminate the Service.

original: Upon cancellation, the Subscriber will be responsible for charges for the full term of the then current billing period and any unbilled charges.
modified: Upon receipt of a cancellation notice, any charges accrued up to the effective date of cancellation, as well as any unbilled charges, shall become the liability of the Service Provider. The Subscriber shall be relieved from further payments only from the effective date onwards.
